document.masterDocTitle: Review of the Epeolus tarsalis species group (Hymenoptera: Apidae, Epeolus Latreille, 1802), with description of a new species

Yasumatsu, 1938: 224
, ♀ , ♂ ( type locality: Ookawa-mura , Tosa , Shikoku , Japan ).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 8–11.
Epeolus tarsalis Morawitz
, female (8—from Jewish Autonomous Prov.; 10—from Irkutsk Prov.),
E . melectiformis Yasumatsu
(9, 11—both from Primorsky Terr.), lateral view. Scale bars: 1.0 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Variation. The females of this species exhibit considerable intraspecific variation in integument coloration and degree of development of the tergal tomentum spots. According to the description ( Yasumatsu 1938 ), the redescription ( van Lith 1956 ) and additional illustrations ( Mitai 2014 ) the Japanese female specimens are mostly black. Unlike these black forms, the continental specimens from Russia and Mongolia possess redder body coloration. All female specimens examined from these territories have entirely or partially red axilla, mesoscutellum, pronotum and mesepisternum ( Figs 9, 11 ), sometimes red patterns can be developed on the mesoscutum (along lateral margins and a pair of spots near posterior margin). The red pattern of mesepisternum varies from a small spot (rare) on upper half to entirely red integument (usually). Two examined females from China ( Inner Mongolia ) are close to the black Japanese form. The males are black and not variable in coloration.
Remarks. This species was previously reported from Russia ( Buryatia and Primorsky Territory) ( Romankova 1995 ) without an exact locality.
